channel.title: Philosophy on Rob Bevan
channel.description: Recent content in Philosophy on Rob Bevan

item.title: The Jean-Paul Sartre Cookbook
item.description: From The Jean-Paul Sartre Cookbook: I keep creating omelets one after another, like soldiers marching into the sea, but each one seems empty, hollow, like stone. I want to create an omelet that expresses the meaninglessness of existence, and instead they taste like cheese. (via Memex 1.1)

item.title: <strike>Jacques Derrida</strike>
item.description: One of my erstwhile heroes, Jacques Derrida, the Blake Carrington of French Philosophy, is dead. Or perhaps now we just refer to him ‘sous rature’: Jacques Derrida.
